channel.title: [PI] Wilderness Ditch
channel.description:
I'm having a problem with this wilderness ditch, when I click on it, it just goes to the other side then back. Example: [URL=http://tinypic.com/r/2qxt9x0/6]View My Video[/URL]
Actionhandler Class: http://pastebin.com/raw.php?i=rvAuCpVS
Clickobject Class: http://pastebin.com/raw.php?i=h04rBuh4

item.title: [PI] Wilderness Ditch
item.dc:creator: @JavaLearner JavaLearner
item.description:
@JavaLearner wrote:

[code]public void wildyditch() {
{
if (c.absY > c.objectY){ //if your Y is greater than the one of the object, meaning you are IN the wilderness

            c.startAnimation(6132);
            c.getPA().walkTo(0, -3); //go 3 spaces down
            } else { // if not, meaning you are outside of the wilderness
                 c.startAnimation(6132);
                 c.getPA().walkTo(0, 3); //go 3 spaces up
               } 
 }[/code]

You’re welcome.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Wilderness Ditch
item.dc:creator: @DerpaDerpy DerpaDerpy
item.description:
@DerpaDerpy wrote:

Turns out the code was fine the way it was, I realized the wilderness interface screen was making the character run back when clicking accept.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Wilderness Ditch
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

Make it so if you are in the X coord (where you was in the start of the code) do this:
c.getPA().walkTo(0, -3);
BUT ONLY IF YOU ARE IN THE X COORD.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Wilderness Ditch
item.dc:creator: @JavaLearner JavaLearner
item.description:
@JavaLearner wrote:


FIX:

[code] c.getPA().walkTo(0, 3);[/code]

You're basically doing the emote and running back 3 spaces.

FIX:

You’re basically doing the emote and running back 3 spaces.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Wilderness Ditch
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

I think it’s your If and Else. [code=java]public void wildyditch() {
{
if (c.absY <= c.objectY){

	c.startAnimation(6132);
	c.getPA().walkTo(0, +3);
	} else if (c.objectY < c.absY) {
	c.startAnimation(6132);
			c.getPA().walkTo(0, -3);
			} 
	}
	}[/code]

Read full topic
